creator: juan2000@aol.com
text:
I have followed all the instructions on setting up and. However, when I try to 
run it I get the following message "The system cannot find the path specified".

I have also tried typing in the full path C:\ant\bin\ant and also with the help 
parameter C:\ant\bin\ant -help and I get the same message as above.

Thanks for your help in advanced.

creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
Perhaps you installed ant in a different directory?  If you are installing ant 
in your C drive, by default, it gets installed in c:\jakarta-ant-1.4

Please try doing a dir on c:\ant and send the result.  If this was the problem, 
please let us know so that we can close the issue.

Thanks,
Magesh

creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
one cause may be that you dont have java installed. try typing 'java -version' 
on a command line and verify that you have an up to date copy of java on the 
path. 

Another is that your ANT_HOME directory does not point to where ant is, so 
when ant.bat tries to call some batch files relative to ANT_HOME(specifically 
ANT_HOME/bin/lcp.bat). 

If you think the issue is that, the debug trick is to edit ant.bat, comment 
out (use REM) the first line (@echo off) and then run ant.bat. You will see 
what the ant batch file does, and where the problem is. 

hope this helps. let us know so we can close this off and presumably file 
under the 'user configuration issue' category.
